title: Authors and Citation
text: Medl M (2024). pytourr: Interactive tourrs using python. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://mmedl94.github.io/pytourr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pytourr: Interactive tourrs using python},   author = {Matthias Medl},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mmedl94.github.io/pytourr/}, }

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: package extension tourr R-package. general overview tourr package please refer tourr documentation. pytourr adds interactive displays functionality tourr allowing users direct path tours.

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: can install development version pytourr github :

title: Interactive tourrs using python
text: run interactive tour first initialize python backend can display saved tour objects, scatterplots histograms interactive_tour()
code: library(pytourr) init_env() library(tourr) data <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) clusters <- as.numeric(flea$species) flea_subspecies <- unique(flea$species)  guided_tour_history <- save_history(data,                                      tour_path = guided_tour(holes())) grand_tour_history_1d <- save_history(data,                                  tour_path = grand_tour(d=1))  half_range <- max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) col_names <- colnames(data)  obj1 <- list(type = "2d_tour", obj = guided_tour_history) obj2 <- list(type = "1d_tour", obj = grand_tour_history_1d) obj3 <- list(type = "scatter", obj = c("tars1", "tars2")) obj4 <- list(type = "hist", obj = "head")  interactive_tour(data=data,                  col_names=col_names,                  plot_objects=list(obj1, obj2, obj3, obj4),                  n_max_cols=2,                  preselection=clusters,                  preselection_names=flea_subspecies,                  n_subsets = 5,                  half_range = half_range,                  size=5)

what: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour

text: R wrapper interactive_tour function written python

title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour
text: data dataset want investigate col_names column names dataset plot_objects named list objects want displayed. entry requires definition type display specification plotted. tours, history object, histograms scatterplots, names variables displayed provided (see example). half_range can specified directly calculated done tourr package. n_max_cols specifies maximal number columns grid final display.

title: R wrapper for the interactive_tour function written on python — interactive_tour

code: render_proj_inter(   data,   prj,   half_range = NULL,   axis_labels = NULL,   obs_labels = NULL,   limits = 1,   position = "center" )

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: data matrix, data frame containing numeric columns, standardised mean 0, sd 1 prj projection matrix axis_labels axes displayed obs_labels labels observations available interactive mouseover limits value setting lower upper limits projected data, default 1 position position axes: center (default), bottomleft

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
text: list containing projected data, circle segments axes

title: Modification of the render_proj() function of tourr so that the half_range is calculated by max(sqrt(rowSums(data^2))) or can be provided as arg — render_proj_inter
code: data(flea) flea_std <- apply(flea[,1:6], 2, function(x) (x-mean(x))/sd(x)) prj <- basis_random(ncol(flea[,1:6]), 2) p <- render_proj(flea_std, prj)
